pull.title: New BIP proposal: BIP280: Hierarchical Deterministic Metanet ROOT nodes
pull.body:
BIP: 280
  Layer: Applications
  Title: Hierarchical Deterministic Metanet ROOT nodes
  Author: Jaime Salom <jaimesalom@moneybutton.com>
  Type: Informational
  Status: Proposal
  Created: 2019-12-17


Abstract:

BIP280 reserves the number 280 of the first level of BIP32 tree structure for the "purpose": Hierarchical Deterministic Metanet ROOT nodes.


Motivation:

The relationship (edge) between any metanet child node with its parent is indelibly established in the bitcoin's Metanet.

However, the relationship between a parentless node (a root node) and the master key (if any) that generated that root node is not established (nor is it desirable in most cases) in the Metanet. A Metanet app needs to know where to look for possible already generated root nodes, and it needs to know where to create Metanet root nodes that can be easily found by other Metanet apps that work with deterministic generation of Metanet nodes.


Background:

[BIP32](https://github.com/moneybutton/bips/blob/master/bip-0032.mediawiki) describes hierarchical deterministic wallets which can be shared partially or entirely with different systems
[BIP43](https://github.com/moneybutton/bips/blob/master/bip-0043.mediawiki) defines the "purpose" of the first level of BIP32 tree structure:  m/purpose'/...
[BIP44](https://github.com/moneybutton/bips/blob/master/bip-0044.mediawiki) reserves number 44 of the first level of BIP32 tree structure for the "purpose": Multi-Account Hierarchy for Deterministic Wallets:  m/44'/...


Specification:

This BIP280 reserves number 280 of the first level of BIP32 tree structure for the BIP43 "purpose": Hierarchical Deterministic Metanet ROOT nodes

Thus, given a "m" master private key, the hierarchically generated Metanet root nodes will be:
m / 280' / 0  --> is the first Metanet root node
m / 280' / 1  -->  is the second Metanet root node
m / 280' / 2  -->  is the third Metanet root node
...

events.message:
Merge pull request #7 from ryanxcharles/transactions

transaction -> transactions

change refundTo to paymail

refundTo broke the idea of bip270 which is p2p payments. It makes more
sense to refund to a paymail which allows p2p payments.

Revert "transaction -> transactions"

This reverts commit ec582727ac26500c9a66b97b251db12ef1ed80de.

There are too many issues using "transactions" instead of a single
"transaction", and all of them can be solved by using multiple payment
requests.

- Error handling is difficult. What is 3 transactions confirm but one
doesn't?
- What if the outputs need to be in the same trasaction, such as an
OP_RETURN? Giving the user flexibility to send multiple transactions
would be invalid in that case. We would need to add a flag that says
"must be in the same transaction".
- It is too difficult to implement at first, so we would not support
multiple right away, requiring another flag.

All of these issues are solved if we simply support one transaction and
if you want to send multiple, you can simply query for multiple payment
requests.

make amount required

We originally changed amount to "optional" because we wanted to support
the "tipping" use-case. However, there is a better way to handle this.
In the query that retrieves the payment request you can specify an
amount. This is specified in the paymail extension:

https://github.com/moneybutton/paymail/blob/87f93fcf3621f1f52cda4a3a4e04eb1ae105e73e/src/06-simplified-payment-protocol.md

specify an amount. for instance, they can request an amount using the
payto: protocol.

# U2800

5 2 0 6    分 divide; small unit of time etc.
5 C 6 4    層 storey, layer, floor, stratum
7 8 B A    確 sure, certain; real, true
5 B 9 A    定 decide, settle, fix

6 0 2 7    性 nature, character
5 1 4 3    元 first; dollar; origin; head
7 D B 2    網 net, web; network
7 D 6 1    絡 enmesh, wrap around; web, net

0x52065C6478BA5B9A602751437DB27D61
Why are there a bunch of commits that having nothing to do with BIP 280? Why is RT's BIP 276 contained inside this?
Also, there is a conflict. Please clean up the commit history and fix the conflict.

> # U2800
> 5 2 0 6 分 divide; small unit of time etc.
> 5 C 6 4 層 storey, layer, floor, stratum

What does all this mean???

Well, I'm new to github, so I am not sure if there's a conflict or what.

I see on top of this page that "23Yc8z (me) wants to merge 63 commits into bitcoin:master from moneybutton:master". But I don't want to do so. I just want to create a BIP.

Have I done anything wrong???
